page.title: 18 The Garage
page.content: Today there is only one garage left at Woodford and it does not sell petrol at present.The name of this garage is Whitecroft Motors and it is situated on the Byfield Road . Andrew Webb and Gordon Pollard are the working partners. Mr Webb is a skilled mechanic and is responsible for the engineeing side of the garage and body repairs .Mr Polland deals mainly with preparing second hand cars for resale. There are five men employed at the garage. As well as routine repairs and maintenance,the garage carries out Ministry of Transport testing on cars over three years old.A certificate of roadworthiness is issued when the vehicle passes the test and is valid for one year. Cars and vans can be hired and school meals are taken from Woodford to Boddington and Chipping Warden.They also mend farm machines.
